intro: Quamoclit langlassei, commonly known as the Langlasse's quillwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Characeae. It is characterized by its finely divided, grass-like leaves that resemble quills, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and invertebrates. Quamoclit langlassei is often found in nutrient-rich waters and can be an indicator of water quality.
